comment: Lectures are useless. Use chegg for the assignments, and join a smart group for the labs. Easy A.
Easy A, take him. The course work is light and enjoyable, the lectures are boring and long. Overall, he's a great professor! Really easy going and understanding. :)
Sometimes hard to understand, but easy grader.  Also, usually has good TAs.
rating_tags: TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Took over the summer so there was a lab during every class, and lab project at the end of the semester so I recommend you don't skip. The material is difficult. There are a few assignments and quizzes and 3 exams, including the final. The professor knows his stuff and willing to explain further if needed. I like him. You should get an A or B.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: Dr. Faruque's class is very straightforward and the lectures are easy to follow. He has a very easy going personality so the class is pretty enjoyable and not too difficult.

You won't get much from the lectures in this class. It is a large classroom and he speaks softly with an accent. He also writes small on the board with a transparent marker. He is an easy grader for the most part. He is also willing to work with students individual situations. So it isn't the hardest class and he is a cool guy but NotTheBestTeacher

Easssyyy A! He's got accent and might be difficult to understand. He is very nice. He will take your assignment if you didn't show up to the class during submission. Attendance is not mandatory. Study from power point and do your hw to get A in his tests.  P.s. talk to someone who has taken his class before for their experience in person.
Nice guy and gives opportunities for missed work. One of the good Professors in the Computer Science Department.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: He's a very chill professor and I would choose him first than the other professor that teaches Computer Organization, Architecture, and Communication class. The class is difficult if you do not have a good grasp on hardware. He has three tests which are worth 10% each and a final exam.
